betterquesting.name: Punch a tree
betterquesting.desc: To survive your first night, you're going to need some wood. You will need it for tools and to build a fire

betterquesting.name: Fire!
betterquesting.desc:
Tough as nails makes surviving, well tough as nails. Craft a fire to keep you warm and provide light for your campsite. You'll get some food for your trouble, and a sleeping bag

Be careful about indoor heatsources, it can get a little toasty.

betterquesting.name: Rudimentary Tooling
betterquesting.desc: Tools are paramount to any survival situation, if you want to do more than sleep under the stars you should craft some wooden tools

betterquesting.name: What's a refractory?
betterquesting.desc: Molten metal is hot, very hot! If you want to move beyond stoneage tools, you're going to need a material that can handle the heat. Check in riverbeds, near lakes and underground.

betterquesting.name: Storage
betterquesting.desc: You quickly realise that your pockets aren't a longterm storage solution and qucikly draft up some storage drawers.

betterquesting.name: Time for an upgrade
betterquesting.desc: Wood is kinda bad at cleaving stone, lets find something tougher to make your tools out of

betterquesting.name: Ooh Shiny
betterquesting.desc: You should be drowning in copper and tin by now. You recall something from your schooling about an alloy called bronze, a much more sutible material than the makeshift tools you had been using. A foundry or kiln to alloy metals might be a good investment.

betterquesting.name: Metallurgy 101
betterquesting.desc: By this point, you are beginning to get a handle on things. Iron is scarce and hard to process without technology, maybe an alloy of copper and tin is your answer?

rewards.command: /say §4You feel as though you are being watched

betterquesting.name: Coke? What's Coke?
betterquesting.desc: Alright, we're getting serious now. You remember that coke is a purified form of coal used in metallurgy (cough steel production cough). You don't have the resources for a crude blast furnace yet but you can certainly start purify coal (and wood) so you're ready!

betterquesting.name: Oh Coke!
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have some metalurgical grade fuel, it's time to start working on refining iron into steel

betterquesting.name: Coke Byproducts
betterquesting.desc: When you drive off all the impurities in coke you get creosote oil! Don't throw it out though, no industrial byproduct is truly a waste. It can be used as furnace fuel and to treat wooden planks.

betterquesting.name: Charcoal Production
betterquesting.desc: The coke oven can also be used to drive oils and resins out of wood, giving you charcoal! It's renewable!

betterquesting.name: Trip to the nether
betterquesting.desc:
You notice some obsidian in your pack, something in the back of your mind calls to you, compelling you to construct a doorway with it and light it ablaze.
§kWill you obery?§4


 You feel disturbed... 

§rYou know from your Engineer's manual that you'll need resources that can only be found in the nether, might as well follow along...

rewards.command: /say §4You feel as though someone... or something... has taken notice of you. If this is a good thing, time will tell...

betterquesting.name: Foundries
betterquesting.desc: You may have noticed that shoving iron ore into a furnace well, didn't work... Until you have a power system, you can't get the furnace hot enough to refine iron. You're going to need a basic foundry! You just need copper, tin and some refractory material... You did make your engineer's manual right?

betterquesting.name: Dawn of technology
betterquesting.desc:
You feel empowered by your recent excursion, although that uneasy feeling has lingered...

Paying no mind to it, it's time to build your crude blast furnace and finally get some technology going!

betterquesting.name: Reference Material
betterquesting.desc: As an engineer, you're going to need to make yourself a textbook...

betterquesting.name: Technology!
betterquesting.desc: It's about time you got working on some tech, your'e going to need a lot of steel...

betterquesting.name: Thirst
betterquesting.desc:
You find yourself getting thirsty. Remembering the rules of 3s, you realise you should find a source of water.


Grab yourself some bottles and fill up!

betterquesting.name: Canteens
betterquesting.desc:
It's great you have water now but those bottles are taking up lots of room in your pack...

If you had some leather, maybe you could fashion yourself a canteen.

betterquesting.name: Mmmm mud
betterquesting.desc:
Well now, you're not dying of dehydration. That water you're drinking though is kinda nasty...
 
If you had some paper and some charcoal, maybe you could filter it...

betterquesting.name: A better water source?
betterquesting.desc: Knowing that rainwater is pretty dang clean, you wonder if there may be some way to capture it for your use.

betterquesting.name: Hunger
betterquesting.desc:
If you're going to survive for any extended period, you'll want to do more than eat porkchops slapped into a coal fired furnace.

Craft some kitchen tools, they won't go to waste.

betterquesting.name: Juicing!
betterquesting.desc:
Juice is refreshing! Why don't you give your new pam's tools a spin?

Might want to use the pear you were given

betterquesting.name: It's about survival, right?
betterquesting.desc:
You're hungry, extremely hungry...

You might even take a bite out of a villager or fellow player...

betterquesting.name: Industrial Revolution
betterquesting.desc:
You've come a long way, survival has been hard but you've been successful thus far.

It's time to start thinking about putting your engineering experience to good use. Your foundry has been useful refining your ores but it's reaching the limits of what it can do with bronze. If you could craft a plate table, maybe you could use it to cast some iron plates? These plates are the foundation of any low voltage machinery, so get casting.

betterquesting.name: Treated Wood
betterquesting.desc:
Creosote has uses beyond filling up tanks. If you soak wooden planks with it, they become fireproof, rot resistant and waterproof. Basically, it's like wood but better.

This treated wood is also used as a basis for many engineering constructs.




§m§k§rIt makes a good creosote sink

betterquesting.name: Necronomicon Ex Mortis
betterquesting.desc:
Ever since you returned from the nether, you've been mumbling to yourself and seeing shadows out of the corner of your eye. You think nothing of it, anyone in your situation would feel the same way you reason.

Still... you can't shake the feeling that another book might be beneficial to your survival on this world. A particularly macabre tome bound in zombie flesh keeps coming to mind.

Unsure where this knowledge is coming from, you oblige this compulsion...

rewards.command: /say VAR_NAME has crafted the Necronomicon, a sickness washes over them

betterquesting.name: Power Generation
betterquesting.desc: Burning material releases a lot of energy you think to yourself, if you had some way of converting it to power you could start working with machines.

betterquesting.name: Sticky Resin
betterquesting.desc:
Transmitting electricity through uninsulated cables is unwise. Latex rubber is a natural and readily availble source of insulation, now if only you could find some rubber trees...

A tree tap may be useful to extract the resin from the trees. Collect some saplings as well, a tree grove will help you.

betterquesting.name: A preverse task
betterquesting.desc:
The book whispers to you while you try to sleep. It speaks of profain rituals that will allow you to tap into the power of the Outer Gods. Reading deeper, you find mention of monstrous creatures known as shoggoths who corrupt the very land with their touch, turning it to unknown stone and creating effigies of the gods.  

You feel you should seek out such a creature and attempt to harvest some of this stone and possibly one of these effigies.+

betterquesting.name: Evil craft placeholder
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: New Quest
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Cable Crafting
betterquesting.desc: Industrial wires are made using uninsulated cables in a crafting grid, make a spool of copper and tin using the provided cables

betterquesting.name: Industrial Wiring
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have a rubber source, you can craft some transmission wires.

betterquesting.name: More rubber
betterquesting.desc: Rubber has lots of uses, it can be used to craft conveyor belts for example. You feel that while baking raw latex in a furnace has served you thusfar, a machine may be more efficient at processing raw latex into usuable material.

betterquesting.name: Metal Working
betterquesting.desc: Metals can be formed into many different useful forms, if you had a metal forming machine you could use it to craft plates, wires and casings without the need of low-tech tools like hammers and cutters. It's slow, but you don't have to do anything but set and forget!

betterquesting.name: Passive Power
betterquesting.desc: You know first hand the power of flowing water. Now that you have acces to steel and treated wood, you can craft several water wheels! There is a maximum of 3 per kinetic dynamo so keep that in mind

betterquesting.name: Power Transmission
betterquesting.desc: You're going to need a way of transmitting power from your generators to your consumers. Luckily, insulated relays and connectors will allow you to do this!

betterquesting.name: TBD
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Awakening
betterquesting.desc: Your eyes open to a barren world, your priority now is to survive.

betterquesting.name: Novice Technomancer
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have access to steel, your options are open. Can power help you escape this world?
